title: Hamas attack on Israel: What US intelligence services told their European counterparts
summary: According to US intelligence, Hamas was surprised by the slowness of the Israeli security forces's response to the offensive by its armed commandos.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Macron calls for international coalition against Hamas
summary: On a visit to Tel Aviv in Israel and Ramallah in the West Bank, the French president also called for a 'decisive relaunch of the political process.'

title: Victor Wembanyama will shine a spotlight on fellow French NBA players
summary: After years without a major sensation, French basketball is about to regain the attention of the American public thanks to the emergence of 'Wemby.' Here are the French players to watch this season on the other side of the Atlantic.

title: Algeria refuses to grant a visa to Nobel Prize-winning writer Annie Ernaux
summary: No explanation was given by the authorities in Algiers. According to observers, the decision may be linked to an article co-signed in May by Ernaux, calling for the release of Algerian journalist Ihsane El Kadi.

title: Tom Emmer withdraws from House speaker race hours after securing nomination
summary: The Minnesota congressman had won the internal Republican ballot to replace Speaker Kevin McCarthy but resigned hours later due to backlash from the party's right-wing led by former President Donald Trump.

title: Champions League: Lens salvages draw as Man United clinches last-minute win
summary: Bayern Munich cruised to a 3-1 victory in Istanbul on Tuesday while Jude Bellingham led Real Madrid to a 2-1 victory over Braga in Portugal and Arsenal bounced back to beat Sevilla.

title: Billionaires rage against anti-Israel students at Harvard
summary: In a joint statement, a number of student organizations at the prestigious American university took sides against the Israeli government in its conflict with Hamas, provoking reactions from outraged donors.

title: Trump's former lawyer, Michael Cohen, takes the stand against him at his New York civil fraud trial
summary: Michael Cohen, formerly Donald Trump's loyal associate turned adversary, revealed in a courtroom face-off that he would 'arbitrarily' inflate the alleged worth of the ex-president's assets to 'whatever number Trump told us to.'

title: Israel-Hamas war: As specter of new front in Lebanon heightens, civilians left feeling abandoned
summary: Hezbollah's attacks are growing in intensity by the day, triggering increasingly strong reprisals from the Israeli army. The Lebanese state has shown its powerlessness in light of the risk of escalation.

title: US states file lawsuit accusing Meta of harming children's mental health
summary: Dozens of US states are suing the social media company for harming young people and contributing to the youth mental health crisis by knowingly and deliberately designing features on Instagram and Facebook that addict children to its platforms.

title: Alphabet and Microsoft report strong profits driven by AI and cloud computing
summary: While Microsoft's Azure cloud service outpaces expectations with a 29% growth in revenue, Alphabet faces challenges in its cloud division, prompting divergent investor reactions.

title: China announces removal of defense minister who had been out of public view for months
summary: General Li Shangfu had been missing with little explanation and is the second senior Chinese official to disappear this year.

title: EU legislators vote to slash the use of pesticides
summary: Despite opposition from some conservative groups, the EU's environment committee voted to set binding targets on reducing pesticide use that target a 50% reduction by 2030.

title: At the Versailles bomb threat trial: 'Louis XIV's throne is going to blow'
summary: A man was given a suspended eight-month prison sentence on Monday, following a phone call that led to the evacuation of the château on October 19. The culprit suffers from schizophrenia.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'Around 50' French citizens stuck in Gaza
summary: Since Hamas's attack on October 7, no one has been allowed to leave the besieged enclave, with the exception of four hostages released by the terrorist movement.

title: Platforms and record labels lobby to block French music streaming tax
summary: Spotify, Deezer, Apple Music, YouTube and the record companies are trying to block a tax suggested by President Emmanuel Macron, intended to finance the National Center for Music.

title: Rothko at the Louis Vuitton Foundation: When color throbs
summary: The Paris exhibition, spanning from October 18, 2023, to April 2, 2024, faithfully embodies the American painter's approach: The succession of rooms, with low-hanging paintings and excellent lighting, creates a remarkable sensory experience for visitors.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Vandalism of historic synagogue in Tunisia shocks Jewish community
summary: On October 17, following the news of the explosion at Gaza's Al Ahli Arab Hospital, a Jewish holy site was attacked to express support for Palestinians at El Hamma, southern Tunisia.

title: Hurricane Otis strengthens to Category 4 storm as it approaches Mexico
summary: The US National Hurricane Center said Otis had maximum sustained winds of 145 mph (230 kph) early Tuesday evening. It was centered about 85 miles (135 kilometers) south-southeast of Acapulco and moving north-northwest at 8 mph (13 kph).

title: 'Bring them home': In Tel Aviv, hostages' families camp in front of Israeli military's HQ
summary: Relatives of people held by Hamas are keeping up the pressure on the Israeli government to make their release a priority over a ground invasion of Gaza.

title: Austrian far-right figures' trip to visit Taliban in Afghanistan raises eyebrows at home
summary: A former Freedom Party of Austria MEP and three party-affiliated individuals visited Afghanistan in late September as an official delegation, leaving the nation surprised and their far-right party leader appalled.

title: Richard Roundtree, star of hit 'Shaft', dies at 81
summary: Roundtree's major debut, 'Shaft' was hailed as a founding classic in the 'Blaxploitation' genre the 1970s were known for – which boosters say tackled race relations while critics blast the style for trafficking in stereotypes.

title: Fake bomb threats: An old phenomenon feeding into prevailing anxiety
summary: Since the murder of a teacher by a terrorist earlier this month, French authorities have opened 64 investigations into bomb threats targeting airports, schools and museums. The firm response, including many evacuations, has had the unwanted consequence of publicizing the trend.

title: Britney Spears' life unveiled
summary: 'The Woman in Me,' the pop star's autobiography, hit bookstores worldwide on Tuesday, October 24, shedding light on her hypersexualized adolescence, pressured abortion and being placed under guardianship by her father. Her revelations also mirror broader aspects of American society.

title: Bangladesh cyclone forces evacuation of nearly 275,000
summary: Cyclone Hamoon, the latest of the numerous and deadly weather events affecting the country and creating climate refugees, has killed at least 2 and left at least 10 injured.

title: Democratic debate, a virtue in wartorn Ukraine
summary: After the sacred unity of the first few months of the war, Ukraine's citizens are not afraid to protest and express their opinions, as in any democratic society.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'Putin is wringing his hands'
summary: The Russian president will look to take advantage of the crisis in the Middle East as it diverts attention from the war in Ukraine and fuels resentment against the 'collective West.' Europeans are alarmed by this danger, observes columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Macron surprises leaders with proposal to 'fight Hamas' with international coalition against IS
summary: The French president's suggestion, made during his visit to Israel, appears highly inflammatory in the Arab world. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, meanwhile, saw it as a symbolic offer.

title: US forces face upsurge in attacks forces in Iraq and Syria
summary: Since October 17, at least 13 armed drone and rocket attacks have targeted bases belonging to the United States and international coalition bases against the Islamic State group.

title: Tour de France: 2024 Florence-Nice route announced
summary: The new route is set to include 3,492 km of road, two Alpine crossings, a time trial finish from Monaco, and the highest starting altitude of any Tour de France.

title: To our readers: On Le Monde's coverage of the explosion at the Al Ahli Arab Hospital in Gaza
summary: Le Monde looks back at the newsroom's coverage of the deadly explosion at the Al Ahli hospital in Gaza on October 17.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'There can be no victory over terrorism without the prospect of peace and freedom for Palestinians'
summary: Speaking out about the horrors committed by Hamas must be a prerequisite for any debate on the Palestinian issue. But it does not justify ignoring the historical and political context in which these atrocities took place, writes MEP Raphaël Glucksmann.

title: After initial prudence, Erdogan calls Hamas a 'group of liberators'
summary: In September, the Turkish president met with the Israeli prime minister for the first time in a decade. On Saturday, he will attend a major rally for Gaza in Istanbul.

title: Moroccans mobilize for Gaza despite the rapprochement between Rabat and Tel Aviv
summary: Since October 15, support for Gaza has continued to spread in many cities, led by coalitions of left-wing parties, trade unions, civil associations and Islamist organizations.

title: Macron announces France will send navy ship to 'support Gaza hospitals'
summary: A French plane will also deliver medical equipment, the president said after meeting with his Egyptian counterpart Abdel Fattah el-Sissi on the latest leg of a crisis tour across the region following the outbreak of the Israel-Hamas war.

title: In the West Bank, Macron seeks to bolster the Palestinian Authority
summary: At the end of a tête-à-tête with Mahmoud Abbas, the French president asserted that 'nothing can justify' the suffering of civilians in Gaza. He called for the 'resumption of a peace process' in order to 'have two countries able to coexist.'

title: Mike Johnson elected US House speaker with broad Republican support
summary: The choice of Johnson – a lesser-known conservative who has the support of Donald Trump – ends weeks of tumult over the leadership role.
